intro: Erodium malacoides subvar. platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Africa. It features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from spring to summer, and its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape with a slightly hairy texture. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
